messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2439
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/4/2002 11:37:48 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... You just need to come to the conference!  Kelly [Non-text portions of this message
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/4/2002 11:37:48 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> > << like when I organized the building of a geodesic dome out of newpapers
> > with
> > our local group. >>
> >
> > Oooh, ooh, ooh! I'm doing those in my workshop at the conference! Fun.
> >
>
> Can you describe how you do that? In enough detail that we could do it? Or
> send us to someplace that has enough description of a method that you think
>
> would really work?
>
> How much time does it take for how big a dome? How many kids? How old and
> how
> hard is it really, to do it?
>
> --pam
>
>

You just need to come to the conference! <BWG>

Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re:Digest Number 2439
messages.msgSnippet: No, actually, I think many of us homeschooling right now are operating out of a public school education (also, a TV generation), so we probably DO think of
messages.messageBody:
No, actually, I think many of us homeschooling right now are operating out
of a public school education (also, a TV generation), so we probably DO
think of Calvin and Hobbs first. After all, for many of us our exposure to
classical music has been through Bugs Bunny cartoons. Deb K.

....that would mesh nicely with our Calvin Curriculum.
As, in Calvin & Hobbs, of course.

But, I realized recently that I when say Calvin Curriculum to the
kabillion right wing homeschoolers here- they look very impressed.
It sounds appropiately Bible-ish.
hee heeee heeeee
Love, Jude
